In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here's how you can define the `clean_column` function in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    # Lowercase the column name
    lc_col = lowercase(col)
    
    # Strip leading and trailing whitespaces
    trimmed_col = strip(lc_col)
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    cleaned_col = replace(trimmed_col, [' ' => '_', '-' => '_'])
    
    return cleaned_col
end
```

This function takes a string `col` representing a column name as input and returns a clean version of the column name in lowercase with no leading or trailing whitespaces and with spaces and hyphens replaced by underscores.

You can use this function like so:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column("my column")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column("my-column")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column(" my   Column ")
"my_column"
```

As you can see, the function is case-insensitive and removes any extraneous whitespace.
